name: df-bigo
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cbigo, cmpt(s0, co(cr, cpm, cr), crab(s1, co(cr, cpm, cr), wrex(s2, cr, wrex(s3, cr, wral(s4, cin(cdm(cv(s1)), co(cv(s2), cico, cpnf)), wbr(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s4)), cle, co(cv(s3), cmul, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s4))))))))))
comment: Define the function "big-O", mapping a real function g to the set of real functions "of order g(x)". Definition in section 1.1 of [AhoHopUll] p. 2. This is a generalization of "big-O of one", see ~ df-o1 and ~ df-lo1 . As explained in the comment of df-o1 , any big-O can be represented in terms of ` O(1) ` and division, see ~ elbigolo1 . (Contributed by AV, 15-May-2020.)
